paper_abstract: The probability that an entity in a set of entities uniformly distributed in space is the nearest neighbor of its nearest neighbor is evaluated for generic distances in a multidimensional environment. Such an expression is then specialized for systems with norm-based distances and for systems with quantized norm-based distance. Examples for scalar products and sup-norm are derived. When appticable, invariances with respect to the underlying distance and entities density are highlighted. Dimensionality effects are investigated.
paper_title: On the nearest neighbor of the nearest neighbor in multidimensional continuous and quantized space
